Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Reiterate \Re*it"er*ate\ (-[=a]t), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Reiterated} (-[=a]`t[e^]d); p. pr. & vb. n. {Reiterating}.] [Pref. re- + iterate: cf. F. r['e]it['e]rer, LL. reiterare to question again.] To repeat again and again; to say or do repeatedly; sometimes, to repeat. [1913 Webster]
That with reiterated crimes he might Heap on himself damnation. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
You never spoke what did become you less Than this; which to reiterate were sin. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
Syn: To repeat; recapitulate; rehearse. [1913 Webster]
reiterate v : to say, state, or perform again; "She kept reiterating her request" [syn: {repeat}, {ingeminate}, {iterate}, {restate}, {retell}]
